Wyrom
Friday, August 11th, 2017, 11:52:48 PM

God
Saturday, August 12th, 2017, 2:21:34 PM

@taernath I really don't want to see Name Changes happening as it would make character selling the standard and not just an aberration. If it did happen, due to our immense selection of sold characters across the level spectrum, it would be the same as selling character levels.

God
Saturday, August 12th, 2017, 2:25:24 PM

Taernath
Saturday, August 12th, 2017, 2:47:44 PM

@god said in Name Purge:

@taernath I really don't want to see Name Changes happening as it would make character selling the standard and not just an aberration. If it did happen, due to our immense selection of sold characters across the level spectrum, it would be the same as selling character levels.

I'm really not seeing the connection between name changes and encouraging character sales, unless you mean people will use the service to either misrepresent themselves or hide from their 'sold' reputation.

I just think that some of us would like the opportunity to take back poorly-chosen names that we thought up when we were kids. Ex: one of my character's names is a semi-obscure villain from a '90s video game, but he's protected from badname because he's been around for so long.

Wyrom
Saturday, August 12th, 2017, 3:00:09 PM

Selling names isn't something we would do. Name changes have been discussed.

God
Saturday, August 12th, 2017, 3:09:39 PM

@taernath Say I wanted to play a Sorcerer and I got a great name. But I wanted to start at 50th level instead of 1st, I could go into the character market and purchase a 50th level character and then get a name change service, effectively letting me skip those 50 levels. Coupled with fixstats and fixskills, it would be exactly the same as if I level'd that brand new character from scratch. This is the problem.

God
Saturday, August 12th, 2017, 3:10:31 PM

@wyrom What was the conclusion to your discussions on name changes?

Taernath
Saturday, August 12th, 2017, 3:24:52 PM

@god said in Name Purge:

@taernath Say I wanted to play a Sorcerer and I got a great name. But I wanted to start at 50th level instead of 1st, I could go into the character market and purchase a 50th level character and then get a name change service, effectively letting me skip those 50 levels. Coupled with fixstats and fixskills, it would be exactly the same as if I level'd that brand new character from scratch. This is the problem.

You're not buying levels. You're buying a character (which is allowed on these boards), then buying a name change on top of that. You're not creating a character out of nothing, the character is already there and for sale, and in any case, Simu would ostensibly be getting a 'cut' via the name change service.

God
Saturday, August 12th, 2017, 3:39:35 PM

@taernath It depends on who you are and why you play. I've already level'd a character from scratch to mid 80's and I really don't want to experience that again, but after stumbling upon a great name and inspiration for RP around that name I started from scratch.

Therefore on a personal level, name changes would be advantageous for me since as soon as this service is provided I would purchase a capped or near capped character then delete my current main who's in his mid twenties and give the capped character my new name. I would be bypassing 5 to 6 years of play by doing this.

Again, personally name changes works for me and for you as well apparently. But thinking about the health of the game I just can't shake the fact that this would be like or similar to selling levels in a roundabout way. I'm just not sure. But, I'm certain Wyrom and Staff would have already figured this out.

By the way, anyone know what Wyrom's stance is officially on name changes?
